hints.content:
On a clock there are two hands. The $\redD{\text{hour hand}}$ is the shorter hand.  The $\blueE{\text{minute hand}}$ is the longer hand.

![A clock shows the short hour hand points to 5. The long minute hand points to 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/45a764740b107b33cf6707c08fe70c7abdbda8c9)

So, $\redD{3}{:}{00} $ looks like this:

![A clock shows the short hour hand points to 3. The long minute hand points to 12. Labels outside the edge of the clock are number 1 through 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/dd8614b6e09886781dab2766a59edb424a5e4a2e)

$\redD{3}{:}{\blueE{10}}$ is $\blueE{10}$ ticks from $\redD{3}{:}{00}.$

![A clock shows the short hour hand is just past 3. The long minute hand points to 2. Outside the edge of the clock 12 is labeled 0, 1 is labeled 5, 2 is labeled 10, and so on with 11 labeled 55.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/077eb2585ece22ffc85510f071f8cc81f31e4628)

Notice the hour hand is past $3{:}00$ but not quite to $4{:}00$.

This clock shows $3{:}{10}$.

![A clock shows the short hour hand is just past 3. The long minute hand points to 2.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/04d247a42c284065ae6c4a16bf1261f1c3632620)

choices.content: ![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 3 and 4. The long minute hand points to 10.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/04d247a42c284065ae6c4a16bf1261f1c3632620)
![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 2 and 3. The long minute hand points to 10.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d8e77aa90538065956e402e21e627bd1fee69922)
![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 2 and 3. The long minute hand points to 10.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/915cf01daf26509302c0a7339c28e4addc28ad28)
